intro: Byttneria asterotricha, commonly known as the star-haired byttneria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
